Most big websites do this too. What are cookies? A cookie is a small text file that a website saves on your computer or mobile device when you visit the site. It enables the website to remember your actions and preferences (such as login, language, font size and other display preferences) over a period of time, so you don’t have to keep re-entering them whenever you come back to the site or browse from one page to another.
	        How do we use cookies? 
	       	Cookies used on our website are grouped into the following categories:
	       	1. Essential - these are cookies that are required for the regular operation of our websites. For example, some cookies allow you to log-in to your account and add products to your basket and checkout securely, or carry out fraud detection and security checks (along with other similar things). These are essential for the website to work properly.
	       	2. Functional-these cookies will enable you to move around the site and use its features such as accessing secure areas (e.g. content for registered users). These cookies also allow us to remember your user preferences, helping you to customize your experience on our site. The information gained through the use of functional cookies is anonymous and is not used for any other purpose.
	       	3. Performance improvers- these cookies will help us understand how effective our content is, what interests our customers and to improve how our website works. This information is used for statistical purposes only and is not used to personally identify any user.
	       	4. Advertising-these cookies enable us and our advertising partners to serve ads and manage our online advertising when you visit our site and sites upon which we advertise. These cookies record your visit to our website and the content you interact with, and may also be used to manage the number of times that you see an advertisement.
 Who sets cookies? Apart from us, also approved third parties may set cookies when you visit the site. Third parties include search engines, providers of measurement and analytics services, social media networks, and advertising companies. Third parties use cookies in the process of delivering content, including ads relevant to your interests, to measure the effectiveness of their ads, and to perform services. How to control cookies You can control and/or delete cookies as you wish – for details, see aboutcookies.org. You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer and you can set most browsers to prevent them from being placed. If you do this, however, you may have to manually adjust some preferences every time you visit a site and some services and functionalities may not work. Participation in the Program is free of charge and no purchase is necessary to become a Participant. The e-mail address and mobile phone number you provide must be current and valid. They will be used to identify you so that you can earn or redeem Likes as explained in Sections 8 and 9 of these Program Terms. MANGO LIKES YOU enables you to earn points, called “Likes,” based on your purchases and other actions and to redeem the Likes you have earned toward the purchase of Eligible Products as explained in Sections 8 and 9 below.  MANGO reserves the right to verify the identity of any Participant before processing any awards, redemptions, or adjustments of Likes for Program purposes such as purchases, exchanges, and returns. Earn Likes through Eligible Purchases Once Participants have identified themselves, they may accumulate Likes by purchasing Eligible Products (defined below) in participating Stores or purchasing online on at a Site. Each award of Likes has an expiration period of one (1) year from the day of the award. If the one-year period elapses without the Participant having exchanged the Likes as explained in Section 9, they will be automatically deactivated. “Eligible Products” refers to garments and accessories that are branded to business lines operated by MANGO. For each Eligible Product purchase made by a verified Participant, the Participant will earn Likes in accordance with the following formula: $1.00 (One Dollar) spent of the “RRP” = 4 Likes = 0.02 Dollar discount “RRP” means the recommended retail price (excluding taxes). If the Eligible Product is on sale (subject to a discount) at the time of purchase, the RRP means the discounted sale price. (excluding taxes) 8.2. Discounts will be applied to the RRP of the Eligible Products (excluding taxes). Under no circumstances may Likes be exchanged for money or for their value in kind. 9.2. https://shop.mango.com/us/en/responsibil: From the moment it's conceived to the moment it's worn. Each and every one of our garments follows this path. This could be done at a fast pace. At Mango, however, we choose to take care of all those who walk this path with us. Taking the time, attending to every step, every stitch, every fold, every finish… Exploring the landscape and gathering more and more fibers with a lower environmental impact. Breathing in the unmistakable, perfect and timeless style with which nature designs every detail, while reducing the footprint our journey may have on the planet. This is our path, which is taking shape as we walk it. And we believe in it. 72% of our fibers now come from preferred sources. 94% of our cotton now comes from preferred sources. 25% of our fibers are now recycled. 67% of all the energy we consume is now renewable. Since 2019, we have reduced the quantity of water used to extract materials by 47%. We are pioneers in the use of paper bags for factory packaging instead of single-use plastic bags: we have prevented the use of 885 tonnes of plastic since the start of the project. We now have Recycling Box containers in our stores in 19 countries and collect around 163 tonnes of textile waste from our customers every year. We are the first major fashion brand in Spain to make public its list of traced factories. 100% of our fibers will come from preferred sources. Our circular economy ambition will extend to the majority of our collection. We will have reduced our Scope 1 and 2 greenhouse gas emissions by 80% and our Scope 3 emissions by 35%. We design all our garments in our atelier in Barcelona. We have a full-time professional team of more than 60 people who guarantee the quality of our products. We carry out almost 20,000 inspections annually at our suppliers' factories to guarantee the quality of our garments. All our products are thoroughly tested to certify that they are safe for use by our customers, complying with the relevant legislation on harmful chemicals. Get to know our preferred-source materials The circular economy offers an alternative to the traditional "throwaway" model of production and consumption, so that materials in use can be reused or recycled, rather than becoming waste. We believe that collaboration is key to achieving this goal. For this reason, we work to identify and support suppliers with established recycling structures and circuits, which allow us to increase the company's percentage of recycled fibers. We design our products with their end-of-life in mind, whether this means ensuring they are recyclable through their composition and construction, promoting durability or using patterns that minimize textile waste. We collaborate with independent laboratories and align ourselves with recognized international standards to offer products with greater durability, in order to strengthen our commitment to circularity. In line with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals, at Mango we offer our customers the chance to give their used clothes and shoes a second chance through our Recycling Boxes. Everything deposited in these containers will be given a new life following the waste management hierarchy: Garments that can be used are distributed in the second-hand channel. The most deteriorated garments are transformed into textile fibers or raw materials for new uses, such as thermal insulation, among others. The product that can no longer be recycled is converted into energy in the form of electricity or steam by controlled combustion. Currently, 100% of our company stores in 19 countries offer this service. In 2019, this project joined our Mango likes you club. Therefore, when customers deposit their used garments in the Recycling Boxes, they will receive 200 Likes* in their account to access exclusive benefits and experiences. *Limited to one recycling every 30 days. Not available in Outlet stores or stores located in airports or corners in department store. At Mango we are committed to respecting and promoting the human rights of all the people we interact with: our teams, customers, workers in the value chain and communities. We have a Human Rights Policy that sets out our highest-level commitment to human rights and is aligned with leading international standards. 100% of our manufacturing plants have a social audit. True to our commitment to diversity, equality and inclusion, we strive to ensure a respectful and inclusive work environment, free of all forms of discrimination. You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer and you can set most browsers to prevent them from being placed. Most big websites do this too. What are cookies? A cookie is a small text file that a website saves on your computer or mobile device when you visit the site. It enables the website to remember your actions and preferences (such as login, language, font size and other display preferences) over a period of time, so you don’t have to keep re-entering them whenever you come back to the site or browse from one page to another.
	        How do we use cookies? 
	       	Cookies used on our website are grouped into the following categories:
	       	1. Essential - these are cookies that are required for the regular operation of our websites. For example, some cookies allow you to log-in to your account and add products to your basket and checkout securely, or carry out fraud detection and security checks (along with other similar things). These are essential for the website to work properly.
	       	2. Functional-these cookies will enable you to move around the site and use its features such as accessing secure areas (e.g. content for registered users). These cookies also allow us to remember your user preferences, helping you to customize your experience on our site. The information gained through the use of functional cookies is anonymous and is not used for any other purpose.
	       	3. Performance improvers- these cookies will help us understand how effective our content is, what interests our customers and to improve how our website works. This information is used for statistical purposes only and is not used to personally identify any user.
	       	4. Advertising-these cookies enable us and our advertising partners to serve ads and manage our online advertising when you visit our site and sites upon which we advertise. These cookies record your visit to our website and the content you interact with, and may also be used to manage the number of times that you see an advertisement.
 Who sets cookies? Apart from us, also approved third parties may set cookies when you visit the site. Third parties include search engines, providers of measurement and analytics services, social media networks, and advertising companies. Third parties use cookies in the process of delivering content, including ads relevant to your interests, to measure the effectiveness of their ads, and to perform services. How to control cookies You can control and/or delete cookies as you wish – for details, see aboutcookies.org. You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer and you can set most browsers to prevent them from being placed. If you do this, however, you may have to manually adjust some preferences every time you visit a site and some services and functionalities may not work. If you cannot agree with this Policy or the Terms and Conditions, please do not visit our Site or use our Services. If we make changes, we revise effective date or last modified date at the top of this Policy. If we make changes that materially affect your privacy rights, we will attempt to provide advanced notice (including via real- or near real-time disclosures) or otherwise via the Site, or by some other means of contact, so that you have a reasonable opportunity to review the changes before you continue to use the Site,or the Services. Policy Modification: We may change this Policy from time to time, to reflect how we are processing your personal data or personal information, if we make changes to the Policy, we will revise the effective date or last modified date at the top of this Policy. If we make significant changes that materially affect your rights, we will attempt to provide advanced notice possibly by posting a banner on the Site or by some other means of contact, so that you have a reasonable opportunity to review the changes. If you do not agree with the modified Policy, please stop use the Site, or the Services CONTENTS Click on the links below to go to a specific section of this Policy. Your trust in our data practices is a key part of our business, and we’re providing this Policy to transparently explain our data practices to you. We collect personal data when you use our Site. Personal data or information is any information that identifies or makes an individual person identifiable. The definition of personal information (used interchangeably in this Privacy Policy with the term “personal data”) depends on where you are a resident. Only the definition that applies to your country or region of residence will apply to you under this Privacy Policy. Personal Information does not include data that has been effectively irreversibly anonymized or aggregated such that we can no longer reasonably use it to identity or re-identify you. The chart below details the Personal Data we collect from you, and explains why we collect that data: Purpose The Personal Information We Collect To create an account with us and to manage your account, to provide you our Services; · Contact information, including email address and password, to register with our Site,or other Services; · Identity and contact information such as name, phone number and shipping address, as well as financial information or payment account information, for delivery, returns, refund, sales tax determinations, and payment operations; · Transaction details, such as return and refund details, gift card number, and order history, in our Services, in order to fulfill basic functions, including processing your payment and return requests, and keeping you informed of the order status and shipping logistics; · Location data at an IP address-based level, to tailor your experience in terms of displaying the appropriate local website, language, or user experience. · Your communication history with us via various channels, such as email, phone, social media, mail, instant chat, and our customer service platform, to respond to your requests, as well as to keep you updated about your account and the Services; · Contact information, such as email address, for email marketing purposes; · Non-directly identifiable device identifiers, operating system information, and cookie information, to direct and measure the effectiveness of the advertising we offer; · Data about how you engage with our Site,and other Services, such as browsing behavior, adding items to your shopping cart, saving items in your shopping cart or otherwise, placing an order, and returns for market research, statistical analysis and the display of personalized advertising based on your activity on our site and inferred interests; · Contact and identity information, such as name, email address and phone number, when you voluntarily elect to participate in a competition, market survey, event or other marketing campaigns organized by us via the Site, or the Services; · To share your personal data with third party advertisers. As permitted by applicable law, your information may also be used by MISSGUIDED or the Promotion sponsor for marketing purposes. Your entry into the Promotion may result in the addition of your information to our mailing list as well as to the mailing list of our promotional partners, both as permitted by applicable law. Acceptance of a prize may require you (unless prohibited by law) to allow us to post publicly some of your information via the Site, such as on a winners’ page. · Your device information, and usage data in our Sitefor system performance analysis, troubleshooting, debugging, security monitoring, and system maintenance, as well as setting default options for you, such as language and currency; · To share your personal data within and across our corporate organization for our business needs and personalization; · Collection of your expressed preferences product reviews “votes” when prompted so we can better understand your preference between items and to provide preference setting options; · The display of information you choose to post on public areas of the Services, for example a customer review or a photograph of you wearing our products. · Information automatically collected through the Site, or Services, such as browser type, device information, operating system and account setting information for fraud prevention, security monitoring, and detection and credit risk reduction; · Log-in data for information security risk control and fraud reporting; · Billing address to verify payment information. · When required, identity information, such as ID- or passport-related information, for customs clearance purposes; · Transaction history and certain personal information about your identity may be collected if needed to handle and resolve questions, legal disputes, for regulatory investigations purpose, information security and to comply with lawful requests from competent law enforcement agencies or courts in compliance with applicable law. We may use your data for any other purpose disclosed to you prior to you first providing us your personal information or which is reasonably necessary to provide the Services or other related products and/or services requested, with your permission or upon your direction. Please note: When communicating with us by email or through forms on our Site,or via the Services, or when you publicly share content through our Services, please do not send us any sensitive information pertaining to yourself or to others. We do not collect or store sensitive personal information (as that term is defined in applicable data protection laws). We may disclose and share your personal information with the parties as described below. Supplier/Service Provider/Processor Services Offered Website hosting services (including cloud storage), mobile app or software optimization services, customer relationship management software, email service providers, or system maintenance services. Third-party payment processing services. Assistance in reaching potential new customers across multiple communications channels, or sharing with affiliated companies that promote our products on their websites. Provision of logistics, warehousing and distribution services, return and exchange services, and order status notification services for your purchased items. Assistance with customer services and support. Identity verification, fraud prevention, or credit risk reduction services to protect our website and our business. Other third parties MISSGUIDED strive to select and work with third party service providers that share our commitment to privacy, data protection, and user trust. The third parties we work with are only allowed to use your Personal Data for contractually defined purposes that our consistent with this Policy, and then only to the extent necessary to achieve those purposes. We also insist that any third party processing Personal Data on our behalf has provided sufficient and reasonable security commitments. Please note that we may disclose, without restriction, anonymized information about the users of our Services, if such information that cannot identify any specific individual. We may use cookies, tags, and similar technologies to automatically collect information on our Site,or Services. Cookies are small texts that are placed on your computer by our Site or, in some cases, by third parties. Tags are certain keywords used to describe your interaction with a particular feature on our Sites,or Services. Tags can be placed by us or by third parties. These, and related technologies, help us understand how you use our Sites,and our Services. If required by law, we will request your consent before using cookies or other tracking technologies. Information within this section describes our use of cookies and your ability to control the use of cookies for advertising-related purposes. As described below, we will not use cookies tags, or similar tracking technologies that process your Personal Data, unless they are Strictly Necessary Cookies, or you opt-in, i.e. consent, by using the cookie banner or consent manager found on our Site. You may withdraw your consent or update your preferences at any time by clicking the “Manage Cookies” link within the website footer. Location Information. You may be able to adjust the settings of your device so that information about your physical location is not sent to us or third parties by (a) disabling location services within the device settings, or (b) denying certain websites or mobile applications permission to access location information by changing the relevant preferences and permissions in your mobile device or browser settings. We maintain reasonable physical, electronic, and procedural safeguards designed to guard your personal data from unauthorized processing, use, or disclosure. Our security measures include physical, technical, and administrative measures to prevent unauthorized access to or disclosure of your information The Internet is not a secure environment , and we cannot guarantee that your personal data will be secure. We therefore strongly recommend that you use a secure method and use a complex password to help us ensure the security of your account. We also strongly advise that you neither share your password with others nor re-use passwords on our Services that you use on other sites, as doing so increases the likelihood of your being the victim of malicious cyber behavior. If you feel that the security of your account or personal data has been compromised, please immediately contact us at data@missguided.com or as otherwise described in the “Contact Us” section below. To exercise your rights under this Policy and applicable law, you may contact us at data@missguided.com(see section 12). 5.1 Access, Rectification, and Deletion of your Personal Information You may have the right under applicable laws to access, rectify, or delete the personal information that we collect. If these rights apply, and you submit a request, we may request data (including personal data and identification) from you to enable us to confirm your identity and determine your right to access such data, as well as to search for and provide you with the personal data we maintain. There are instances where applicable laws or regulatory requirements allow or require us to refuse to provide or delete some or all of the personal information that we maintain. To exercise your rights, you may make updates within your customer account on the Site, or you may contact us at data@missguided.com. Notwithstanding the approaches of exercising your rights stated above, this is without prejudice to your right to lodge a claim or compliant with your data protection authority. We will retain your Personal information, , including any correspondence you have with us, only for as long as is necessary for the purposes set out in this Policy, including retaining Personal Data in order to comply with our legal obligations, to resolve disputes, for information security purposes, and to enforce our legal rights, terms, and policies Our Site may contain links to third-party sites. This Policy does not apply to those third-party sites. We recommend that you read the privacy statements of any other sites that you visit as we are not responsible for the privacy practices of those sites. Our Services are not directed to, and we do not knowingly collect personal information from, children under the age of 16 or minors. If you are a minor, please do not attempt to fill out our forms or send any personal information about yourself to us. If a minor has provided us with personal information without parental or guardian consent, the parent or guardian should contact us immediately to remove the relevant personal information and unsubscribe the minor. If we become aware that a minor has provided us with personal information, we will take steps to promptly delete such information from our files. As described further in our Terms and Conditions, please do not upload photographs showing other people, in particular if they are minors. When you access or use our Services, your personal data may be processed or transferred outside of the country where you reside, including to China, Singapore and/or United States. Such countries may have data protection laws that are different or less protective than the laws of the country or region in which you reside. For these transfers, we rely on appropriate safeguards as permitted under applicable law and standards, including relying on Standard Contractual Clauses and other appropriate safeguards as permitted under the GDPR for transfers out of the European Union, the European Economic Area, the UK, or Switzerland (if any). If you do not want your information transferred to, processed, accessed, or maintained outside of the United States, you should immediately stop accessing or using the Site. https://bananarepublic.gap.com/browse/me: Specifically chosen for the dapper and emboldened, men’s new arrivals at Banana Republic use an array of fabrics, prints, and silhouettes to take you through the seasons with ease, especially when it comes to linen. A LAND OF LINEN There’s a reason world travelers always circle back to this incredible fabric. Linen is a beloved luxury item from season to season, primarily for its breathability. Whether worn under a blazer or solo, men’s linen shirts and linen pants have the magical ability to stay cool and comfortable, even when temperatures rise. Many say it’s the perfect garment for adventure as it dries faster than other fabrics and retains its durability — an easy-care option for adventures that require sink washing. Our designers are especially proud of our men’s sweaters with beautiful craftsmanship and color depth to take with you on every journey in need of rugged wardrobe options. Let us explore layering as a way to open up multiple ways of wear, like men’s shorts paired with men’s cotton sweaters. THE ART OF LAYERING Men’s dress shirts are a foundational piece in any wardrobe. But when away on business or pleasure, styling options may tend to run low. That’s where BR comes to the rescue with layerable pieces to draw out your closet with ease. Take our men’s dress shirts and style them three ways. Sure, this classic style looks incredible alone, but have you considered wearing it under our men’s sweaters? Or perhaps unbuttoned and layered over a casual t-shirt men's casual pants. Are cooler temperatures of concern? Reach for one of our most luxurious fabrications: warm Merino wool blended with plush cashmere. The options are endless when it comes to dressing for your journey, and not every adventure requires a suit (thought our men’s suits are considerably dapper). PANTS THAT TRAVEL We’d be doing you a disservice if we didn’t mention our cargo pants. Made to journey with you for seasons to come, our men’s cargo pants are perfectly tapered with plenty of pocket space to store everything you need while keeping your hands free.

https://shop.mango.com/us/privacy-policy: Latest version: 12/02/2024 This Privacy Policy—United States describes how MANGO-NY and its parent affiliate company, PUNTO FA, S.L., individually and collectively doing business as MANGO (“we,” “us,” “our”), collects, uses, and shares personal data about people who visit us (“you,” “your”) online at shop.mango.com/us and other MANGO websites and mobile applications (“MANGO App”) where this Privacy Policy is posted (collectively, “Sites”), shop in person at our stores in the United States (“Stores”), or communicate with us in other ways and your choices and rights regarding your personal data. Please review this Privacy Policy carefully. By visiting our Sites or Stores or communicating with us in other ways, you are agreeing to the collection, use and processing of your personal data as described in this Privacy Policy. If you do not agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy, please do not access our Sites, or provide your personal data. Based in Barcelona, Spain, MANGO has focused on creativity and dynamic design in the fashion and lifestyle industry for the past four decades. You can contact our corporate headquarters at: Postal address: Atención al Cliente, carrer dels Mercaders 9-11 (Polígono Industrial Riera Caldes), 08184 Palau-solità i Plegamans (Barcelona), Spain Telephone number: 1.866.6MNGMNG (1.866.666.4664) Email address: personaldata@mango.com Registered at the Mercantile Register of Barcelona under Volume 11195, Folio 156, Sheet 167948 and with Corporate Tax ID no. ES-B59088948. We use the term “personal data” in this Privacy Policy to refer to information in any form that identifies, relates to, describes, is reasonably capable of being associated with, or could reasonably be linked, directly or indirectly, with a particular consumer. MANGO collects personal data that you submit to us, is collected online using cookies and similar internet technologies, when you visit our Sites, and when you communicate with us in other ways. We also may receive personal data from social media, marketing resources, and other third parties. We collect personal data, for example, when you: This Privacy Policy does not apply to: Collection by third party websites. Our Sites may contain links to social media and third-party websites that we do not operate or control. These may include, for example, credit/debit processors and installment sales providers. The information practices and the content of these third-party sites are governed by their own privacy practices. We encourage you to review the privacy statements posted by third-party websites to understand how they will manage your information. Anonymized or aggregated information. Information that has been modified in a substantial way so that it no longer can reasonably identify or be linked to an individual. Employment and business communications. Information we obtain about our employees, job applicants, and other personnel and the employees and representatives of business customers, service providers, suppliers, and business partners (except as explained in the section titled Notice for California Residents: your California Privacy Rights). Below are the categories of personal data collected by or on behalf of MANGO in the preceding twelve months and examples of the types of data, including personal data, within each category. Identifying information. We will ask for the following direct identifying information when you: Online identifiers. When you visit our Sites, we automatically collect the online identifiers for the device you are using, including the IP address, mobile device identifier, and advertising identifier. Contact information. We request a postal address for shipments and your e-mail address and telephone number for online order confirmations and other transaction and marketing communications. Payment information for purchases. When you place an order online, we will ask for your name, e-mail address, phone number, payment card number and other details, contact preferences, and shipping information. Your payment will be processed using a system certified under the Payment Card Industry-Data Security Standards (PCI-DSS), which may be operated either by MANGO or by a third-party payment processor. If a third-party processor is used, you will be transferred to the processor’s website to provide your card information. MANGO stores the expiration date and postal code associated with your payment card but does not store your full payment card number or the CVV number. Instead, we use a service provider to create a token we can store that represents your card’s primary account number. If you choose to pay using a payment service such as PayPal or an installment service such as Klarna or Afterpay, the third-party service may require your name, email address, payment card, and other information. The service partner may provide some non-financial information to us. In-store purchases using a credit or debit card are processed by third-party payment processing service and MANGO does not collect token or other information. Transaction history. Your MANGO account contains your transaction history including products you selected, your purchases, clothing sizes, loyalty rewards you earned, installment purchases, and other account information. Internet activity. We automatically collect information when you visit our Sites, logon to your online account, interact with MANGO content on a third-party site or app, or interact with an email from MANGO. For example, we may collect your browser and device type, internet browsing and search history, frequency, and duration of visits to our Sites and your browsing session, the pages you visited on our Sites, the website you came from and the website you go when leaving our Sites. (For more information see our Cookie Policy.) Geolocation data: With your consent, we may show you the nearest MANGO stores using your specific mobile device location if enabled on your device or your approximate location based on your IP address when using a computer. You can also enter an address, zip code, or place name to get information about MANGO store locations. Video data: We may use video monitoring services in our Stores for security purposes. Information used to profile and make inferences about your preferences and interests. We may draw inferences about your preferences and interests from the data we collect from various sources such as your transaction history, browsing activity on our Sites, and frequency of your visits to MANGO Sites and Stores. We use personal data to conduct our business, stay in contact with our customers, and provide products and services to meet their interests and expectations, including to: Personal data collected by MANGO is disclosed or accessible to data processors and independent third-party services who assist or partner with us in conducting our business and commercial activities, for safety and security purposes, and as required to comply with applicable laws. MANGO does not sell your personal data for monetary consideration. Third-Party Service Providers: Third parties may have access to or process your personal data for the purpose of providing business services for us, such as: processing payments; fulfilling and shipping orders; hosting, maintaining, and securing our Sites and Site features; conducting e-mail and other marketing programs; and providing IT technical support including systems management, data backup, and storage. We do not permit our third-party service providers to use the personal data that we make available to them for their own commercial purposes. Online Technical and Analytics Services:  We use Google Analytics and other authorized third-party services to measure and evaluate access to and traffic on our Sites, identify a user’s language and other preferences, authenticate a user when logging in to the user’s account, and identify ways to improve our Sites’ performance and functionality. These third-party services operate independently from us and have their own privacy policies, which you should review before providing your personal data. (See, for example, Google Analytics-Data privacy and security.) See our Cookie Policy for information about choices you can make about how we collect and use data when you visit our Sites. Digital Advertising Services. We may use digital advertising techniques to show you personalized content on our Sites and to show MANGO ads when you visit social media platforms and third-party websites. We may authorize digital advertising services such as social media, advertising networks, and search engines to place cookies, pixels, and similar technologies on our Sites to track your usage of our Sites and other internet sites. These services operate as independent data controllers with respect to the collection and use of your personal data and have their own privacy policies and practices for the collection and use of personal data. We also may share your e-mail address or device ID on a secure basis with the advertising services, which they use to display MANGO banners and ads to you when you visit third-party sites and measure how many people click on our ads. See our Cookie Policy for more information about cookies and how you can restrict the types of personalized advertising that involve tracking your internet activity in a way that identifies you. Affiliates. We may share information, including personal data, with companies that share common corporate ownership with MANGO, and they may use that information for purposes that are consistent with those described in this Privacy Policy. With Your Consent. We may share personal data with third parties when we have your consent to do so. Security and Protection. We may disclose personal data or other information that we believe is appropriate or necessary to (1) protect ourselves or others from fraudulent, abusive, or unlawful uses or activity, (2) comply with applicable laws and regulations, (3) investigate and defend against claims or allegations and enforce our contracts, (4) protect the security or integrity of our Sites and the systems used to operate the Sites, (5) protect our Stores, property, and legal rights and the property, rights, and safety of others. Law Enforcement, Legal Process and Compliance. We may disclose personal data or other information if required to do so by law or when we reasonably believe such action is necessary to comply with applicable laws, in response to a facially valid court order, judicial or other government subpoena or warrant, or to otherwise cooperate with law enforcement or other governmental agencies. Business Transaction Parties. We reserve the right to disclose or transfer your personal data, subject to appropriate confidentiality safeguards, in connection with a business transaction such as a financing, reorganization, merger, or sale of a business. We maintain commercially reasonable security measures appropriate to the nature of the personal data we collect. However, neither people nor systems can operate in a fully secure manner and no method of transmission over the internet or storage of electronic data is fully secure. While we use commercially reasonable efforts to protect your personal data, we cannot guarantee the security of the personal data you provide to us. Our Sites permit you to create an account protected by a password you create. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your password, and you are responsible for any access to or use of your account by someone else who has obtained your password from you, even if that person was not authorized by you. You should notify us of any unauthorized use of your password or account, and, if any unauthorized use is suspected, you should immediately reset your password. If you have reason to believe that your interaction with us is no longer secure, please immediately notify us of the problem. All purchase transactions made on our Sites are processed using secure payment systems operated either by MANGO or third-party payment processors. Confidential payment details are transmitted directly in encrypted format (SSL). We and our payment processors manage your credit card information in accordance with the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standards. Important reminder: You should never provide your credit or payment card details in an e-mail or on social media. We will retain your personal data for as long as we are continuing to communicate or provide services to you and as reasonably necessary to carry out the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy, comply with our legal obligations, enforce agreements, and resolve any disputes. To determine the appropriate retention period for personal data, we consider the amount, nature and sensitivity of the personal data, the potential risk of harm from unauthorized use or disclosure of your personal data, the purposes for which we process your personal data and whether we can achieve those purposes through other means, and the applicable legal, regulatory, tax, accounting, or other requirements.  In some circumstances we will anonymize your personal data (so that it can no longer be associated with you) for research or statistical purposes, in which case we may use this information indefinitely without further notice to you. The MANGO Sites are directed to users who are of legal age in the state in which they live (often, but not always, age 18). In addition, MANGO does not knowingly collect personal data about children under the age of sixteen (16) years without consent from a parent or legal guardian. If you have reason to believe that we have obtained personal data about a child under age 16 without the appropriate consent, please contact us as explained in “How to Contact Us” and we will investigate and delete the information. E-mail marketing. You can opt-out of receiving marketing communications from us by following the “unsubscribe” instructions included in each of our e-mail marketing communications, and we will process your request to unsubscribe within ten business days after receiving it. You can also opt-out by emailing us at personaldata@mango.com and providing the names/email address that you want us to remove you from our marketing database and add you to our ‘Do Not Contact’ list. If you opt-out of marketing messages, we may still send e-mails to you that involve your orders or responses to your questions. Text messages. If you previously gave us permission to send recurring automated promotional and personalized marketing communications to you by text message, you can withdraw that consent at any time by replying following the directions provided in the text message you received. It may take up to seven days to process your request to STOP text marketing messages. If you have a MANGO online account, you can update, correct, delete, or change your account information, preferences and subscriptions and consents to receive newsletters, emails, and other marketing communications, and by logging into your account from any of our Sites. If you do not have a MANGO account, please contact us as explained in “How to Contact Us.” MANGO offers loyalty programs, benefits, and account sign-up discounts for our customers in various locations. Examples of the programs we offer include the following. The MANGO Likes You. In jurisdictions where available, MANGO Likes You is a loyalty reward program for all customers when they register an online MANGO account, by providing their name, e-mail address, mobile phone number, and a password. It is also available to customers who sign up for the program in-Store by providing their name, e-mail address, and mobile phone number. Participants accumulate points, called “Likes,” when they purchase MANGO products or take actions such as recycling MANGO products or picking up online purchases in-Store. Members also may receive information about new products, sales, and promotions. If you choose to submit your date of birth, you will receive extra Likes as our birthday gift to you. No purchase is required to participate. You can read the detailed terms of the MANGO Likes You program on our Sites to find out how to earn Likes, use your Likes to make purchases, when they expire, and other information about the program. Newsletter Subscription. We may also offer a discount off the next purchase to customers who subscribe to our e-mail newsletter by providing their e-mail address. We use your e-mail address to send newsletters, special offers and other promotional messages. Your information may be shared with our email and advertising providers. You may unsubscribe from our newsletters and other marketing emails using the “unsubscribe” link in each e-mail or contact us. The purpose for offering loyalty program benefits to our customers includes expanding our direct marketing outreach, enhancing our customers’ shopping experience, and encouraging repeat business. Because these benefits involve some of personal data, they may be considered to offer a financial incentive or price or service difference under California and other states’ privacy laws. For our MANGO online account holders, we do not request any additional personal data to be enrolled in MANGO Likes You. In situations where additional personal data is requested (such mobile phone number for in-Store enrollment) or birth date to receive an incentive reward, we believe the program benefits are reasonably related to the value to us of the personal data requested and the costs we incur in providing the program. For more information see “Notice for California residents: your California privacy rights—Financial incentive programs.” Your Privacy Rights. MANGO respects your privacy concerns and legal rights regarding your personal data. We will process your request to exercise the following privacy protections even if you do not live in a place where these are required by law. The right to know—the right to know what personal data we have about you and request copies of your personal data collected about you. The right to correction—the right to request that we correct or update any information you believe is inaccurate or has changed. The right to opt-out of targeted advertising—the right to direct MANGO not to collect or use your personal data for advertising that is based on personal data obtained on our Sites or by third-party ad partners based on your activities over time and across nonaffiliated websites or online applications to predict your preferences or interests. The right to deletion—the right to request that we delete your personal data, subject to legally permitted reasons for which we may decline your request in part or in whole. The right to data portability—the right to request that provide a copy of the digital data we have collected about you to your or another organization as you direct, subject to legally permitted conditions. The right to withdraw consent—the right to revoke your consent previously granted to any collection, use, or sharing of personal data for which we requested, and you provided, your affirmative consent. Depending on your state of residence, you may have additional legal rights with respect to your personal data that we will follow to the extent applicable to our operations. For example, some states may require a specific procedure for consumers to appeal from the denial of all or part of a consumer’s request to exercise certain right. If you are a resident of the State of California, please review the section titled “Notice at collection For California Residents: California Privacy Rights” regarding other personal data rights you may have under California law. You can use the following methods to exercise any of the privacy rights described above: Forms: privacy request form E-mail: personaldata@mango.com Toll-free telephone: 1.866.666.4664We will make every effort to respond within forty-five (45) days from when we receive your request and not later than may be required by applicable law. To protect the security of our customers’ personal data, we will follow appropriate and any legally required procedures to verify the identity of the person asking to exercise these rights. The personal data collected on our MANGO USA Sites and from customers in our Stores in the United States may be processed in the United States, Canada, Spain, and other countries of the European Economic Area in accordance with applicable laws and the guidelines of this Privacy Policy. The MANGO USA companies and Sites follow the information and consumer protection laws of the United States and its individual states. If you reside or are located in a different country, the data protection laws of that country may differ as to how your personal data is protected. We want you to understand that when you provide your personal information to us, or we obtain your information through MANGO USA Sites or other communications with us, you are giving us your express consent to transferring your personal information to, and processing your personal information in, the United States, subject to U.S. laws and the terms of this Privacy Policy. We reserve the right to amend this Privacy Policy at any time in order to address future developments MANGO’s business, changes in industry trends, or changes in legal requirements. If we materially alter the terms of this Privacy Policy, we will post the revised Privacy Policy on our Sites and provide other notification as may be required by applicable law. Any changes will become effective upon the posting of the revised Privacy Policy on the Sites. You can determine when the Privacy Policy was last revised by referring to the “Last Updated” legend on the top of this Privacy Policy.By continuing to use the Sites following such changes, you will be deemed to have agreed to such changes. If you do not agree with any or all of the terms of our Privacy Policy as in effect at any time, you should not continue to use the Sites. To (1) update, correct, delete, or change your preferences, or (2) submit a question or complaints about this Privacy Policy or about our privacy practices, please contact us: MANGOCustomer Service Department561 BroadwayNew York, NY 10012 You can use the following methods to exercise any of the privacy rights described in the section titled “What are my rights concerning my personal data?” If you are a California resident, see also “How to Submit a California Consumer Request.” If you are a California resident, this section of our Privacy Policy describes your rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act of 2018, as amended by the California Privacy Rights Act of 2020 (together, the “CCPA”). This section applies only to personal data about California residents and their households, including representatives of companies doing business with MANGO. Categories, sources, purposes, and sharing of personal data. Please see the sections of our Privacy Policy listed below for a description, by categories, of the (1) sources of personal data collected by MANGO (2) types of personal data collected, (3) business or commercial purposes for collecting personal data, and (4) third parties to whom we disclosed personal data or shared it for purposes of personalized targeted advertising: Your rights under California law. If you are a California resident, you can submit a request to MANGO to exercise your personal data rights under the CCPA (“consumer request”). The process for exercising your rights is described in the paragraph titled “How to submit a consumer request” and the methods we use to verify a consumer request are described in the paragraph titled “How we verify a consumer request” Your rights as provided in the CCPA are summarized below. Right to know. You can request to know the following about your personal data we have collected about you, and we will provide the following with respect to the preceding 12 months: Right to request changes or corrections. You can ask us to correct or update personal data we have about you, and we may consider relevant circumstances to confirm the accuracy of the changes you request such as: If you have an account with us, you can directly update or correct some of the personal data in your account by logging onto your account. If you do not have an account with us, please see “How to submit a California consumer request” to learn how to submit a request to us to correct your inaccurate personal data. Right to request deletion. You have the right to request that we delete personal data which we have about you, subject to specific exceptions permitted by law. We are not required to delete personal data if it is necessary to complete a transaction, we continue to use it for a business purpose compatible with the context in which you provided the information, or we are required by law to retain to retain the information. If you submit a request to delete personal data, we will confirm receipt of your request within ten (10) days and follow appropriate procedures to verify the identity and authority of the person submitting the request. If your request is verified, we will delete or fully de-identify (and direct our service providers and contractors to delete or de-identify) all or part of the requested personal data from our (and their) records, unless an exclusion applies. If we are unable to fulfill all or part of your request, we will let you know why (for example, if we have a permitted reason to retain certain information or if the identity of the requesting person cannot be verified). For technical reasons and to maintain anonymous business statistics, we may anonymize or aggregate personal data rather than erase it completely from our systems. Right of non-discrimination for the exercise of your privacy rights. You have the right not to receive discriminatory treatment or retaliation for the exercise of the privacy rights conferred by the CCPA. MANGO respects your privacy rights and will not discriminate against you if you exercise any of your rights. Right to opt-out of sharing personal data for targeted advertising. You have the right to direct us (opt-out) not to collect or share your personal data with third parties for the purpose of showing you targeted advertising based on data collected from your browsing activity on our Sites and other websites as collected by digital advertising companies. At any time, you may opt-out of our targeted advertising program by using this link on our Sites: "COOKIE AND PRIVACY PREFERENCES" You can also direct us not to collect or share your personal data for targeted advertising by sending us an e-mail request at personaldata@mango.com  or by submitting a request through our FORMS Unless you direct us not to collect or share your personal data for targeting advertising through your cookies selection or contacting us by e-mail, we may share personal data collected from your activities on our Sites with our authorized advertising partners. They use the data collected from your activity on our Sites together with data about your activity on other websites to show you online advertisements that are intended to be relevant to your interests. Notice of right to opt-out of the sale of personal data. MANGO does not sell personal data for monetary consideration, and we have no plans to do so. If applicable laws consider our targeted advertising program to involve a non-monetary “sale” of personal data, you can opt-out of targeted advertising at this link: "COOKIE AND PRIVACY PREFERENCES" You can also opt-out by sending us an e-mail request at personaldata@mango.com  or by submitting a request through our FORMS How to submit a California consumer request. You may submit a request to exercise your California consumer rights to request to know, correct, delete, or opt-out of sharing personal data for targeted advertising by contacting us in any of the following ways: E-mail: personaldata@mango.com Toll-free telephone:    1.866.666.4664 Note: To opt-out of sharing your personal information for targeted advertising purposes, you need to indicate your preference by turning off Advertising Cookies / Do Not Share My Personal Information at this link: Online: COOKIE AND PRIVACY PREFERENCES E-mail: personaldata@mango.com How we verify a consumer request. We are required to verify the identity any person submitting a request to know, correct, or delete personal data. If you make a request on behalf of someone else, we will need to verify your authority to make that request and may require confirmation signed by the consumer. We use methods of verification specified in the CCPA regulations such as matching information we have on file for you, such as your full name, email and postal address, phone number, and transaction history. We reserve the right to deny a consumer request if the identity or authority of the requesting party cannot be confirmed. How we respond to consumer requests. We will confirm receipt of your consumer request within ten (10) business days and may request additional information necessary to verify that you are authorized to make the request. We will respond to any verifiable consumer request within forty-five (45) calendar days of receiving it, subject to delays and exceptions permitted by law. If we require more time to respond, we will let you know the reason and the extension period in writing. We will respond to your request by using the email address or U.S. Postal address you provided to us when making the request. If your request relates to personal data we have collected about you, we will provide information collected or Stored during the 12-month period before receiving your verifiable request. We do not accept or respond to requests to exercise rights sent by postal mail. If we cannot comply with all or part of your request, we will explain the reasons why. For data portability requests, we will select a format to provide your personal data that is readily useable and should allow you to transmit the information readily from one entity to another entity. We do not charge a fee to process or respond to your verifiable consumer request unless it is excessive, repetitive, or manifestly unfounded. If we determine that the request warrants a fee, we will tell you why we made that decision and provide you with a cost estimate before completing your request. We will not discriminate against you if you make a request about your personal data. Loyalty and Financial incentive programs. As explained in the section of our Privacy Policy titled “Loyalty programs,” customers who open an online account with MANGO are automatically enrolled in our MANGO Likes You loyalty program where available and no additional personal information is required. Customers may enroll in the program in-Store where available by providing their name, e-mail address, and mobile phone number. Additional incentives may be offered to customers who submit other personal data such as their birth date.  By opening a MANGO online account or enrolling in-Store in the MANGO Likes You program, customers may receive a more favorable price or rate for products and services than is available to customers who do not participate in the programs. Please see the Terms and Conditions on our Sites for details about the current loyalty programs available where you reside. Under the CCPA, differences in price or rate for loyalty program participants are not discriminatory and permitted if they are reasonably related to the value of the personal data collected by choosing to participate the loyalty program. We estimate that value or personal data collected via a loyalty program by taking into account the anticipated revenues from enhanced sales of products incentivized by the program and the expenses we incur in providing the program. Those expenses may include, for example, the cost of discounting purchases made by program participants, managing, and operating the program, and offering free shipping on some purchases. Based on that estimate, we believe in good faith that the price or rate differences offered through our programs are reasonably related to the value of the participants’ data. California rights under “shine the light” law. California residents may request a list of the types of customer information we provided to third parties for their direct marketing purposes and the names and addresses of all third parties with which we have shared such information during the past calendar year. We will provide the information to you free of charge within 30 days of your request. You can request this information by emailing personaldata@mango.com. Within thirty (30) days of receiving your request, we will provide you with the information at the address you designate in your request, which may be an email address or postal address. Cookies pixels, beacons, and similar internet technologies (collectively referred to as “cookies”) are files installed on a computer, telephone, tablet, or other device to record data about the user’s activity during each browsing session on a website or mobile application. The data collected by means of cookies can be stored and used, for example, to: Cookies are categorized by how long they remain active and whether they are set by the website operator or a third party. Session Cookies are temporary cookies that are activated when a user opens a website and expire either when the user leaves that website or closes their browser. They retain limited information during the session allowing the user to move around the website without re-entering information. persistent cookies remain on a user’s hard drive even after a browsing session and are used to store a user’s settings, preferences, and other previously provided information so the information can be reused when the user returns to that website. These cookies remain on the user’s device until they expire or are deleted. First-party cookies are created and placed by MANGO on the websites and mobile applications MANGO owns and operates (collectively, “Sites”). These cookies are used primarily to manage Site functionality and obtain information to improve the user’s browsing experience. third-party cookies are persistent cookies placed by third-party digital advertising and analytics services and social media platforms authorized by MANGO to use cookies on our Sites for specific advertising and analytics purposes. These services are independent controllers with respect to the personal data they collect on our Sites. MANGO is not responsible for their privacy practices. We recommend that you read the privacy policies of these third-party services to learn how they collect and use your personal data and how you can restrict, delete, and opt-out of their data collection. MANGO respects your privacy, and we want you to be able to decide which types of cookies may be collected on each of our Sites. General information about the types of cookies used on our Sites is provided below. Specific information about the types of cookies currently used on our Sites is available at this link (where you can make or change your cookie and other preference selections): COOKIE AND PRIVACY PREFERENCES General Information about Cookies Examples of Cookies Summary Description Strictly Necessary Cookies These cookies are necessary for websites and mobile apps to function and cannot be disabled by the user. They are typically configured to respond to actions taken by the user, such as adjusting privacy preferences, logging into an online account, or completing forms. The user can configure their browser to block or send an alert to the user when cookies are placed on their browser, but some parts of the site may not work properly if blocked. These cookies do not store directly identifiable information. Preference or customization cookies These cookies allow the site to personalize the user’s experience by remembering the user’s preferences and selections from previous visits. For example, these cookies enable recognition of the user’s preferred language, the type of browser, and the country or region where the user accessed the Sites. Not accepting these cookies could slow performance or not accurately restore preferences. Site analytics cookies These cookies are generally placed by authorized third-party services such as Google Analytics enable the site operator to measure the number of site visitors, track time spent, pages navigated, and links clicked on the site, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of the site. Targeted advertising cookies /Do Not sell or share my personal information for targeted advertising These cookies are generally placed by authorized third-party digital advertising networks and social media to analyze a user’s browsing habits over multiple Internet websites and display advertising targeted to the user’s browsing profile. Although these cookies do not store directly identifiable personal data, they collect the unique identifier for a user’s browser and device and information about the user’s internet activity that can be combined to develop a profile about the user’s interests and behavior. Social Network Cookies Social media platforms place cookies on a site to collect information about how their social media users interact with that site and enable social media users to share site content with social friends and networks. These cookies are also used when a site user clicks a “like” button on a site or connects to a site from their social media account. These cookies track a user’s browsing activity across other websites and collect data to build a profile about a user. Social media cookies and pixels are used to display site ads to users on their social media platforms and measure the effectiveness of ads.  Opt-out from targeted advertising. Some states may consider MANGO’s digital advertising program to involve selling or sharing personal data for purposes of “targeted advertising.” You can elect to opt-out from the selling or sharing of your personal data for targeted advertising purposes by using the link available on the homepage of our Sites and here: COOKIE AND PRIVACY PREFERENCES Disabling cookies. You can allow, block, restrict, or delete the cookies installed on your device using the settings options available in your web browser. If you block certain cookies, the services on our Sites that require their use may not be available to you. You also can configure the categories of optional cookies enabled or disabled on our Sites by clicking on this link: COOKIE AND PRIVACY PREFERENCES Below are links to information on how to enable your preferences on some commonly used web browsers: If you have previously allowed third-party cookies, you can delete them using your web browser setting options or from the system offered by the third-party itself. It enables the website to remember your actions and preferences (such as login, language, font size and other display preferences) over a period of time, so you donât have to keep re-entering them whenever you come back to the site or browse from one page to another.

	       	Cookies used on our website are grouped into the following categories:

These are essential for the website to work properly.
	       	2. Functional-these cookies will enable you to move around the site and use its features such as accessing secure areas (e.g. content for registered users). These cookies also allow us to remember your user preferences, helping you to customize your experience on our site. The information gained through the use of functional cookies is anonymous and is not used for any other purpose.
	       	3. Performance improvers- these cookies will help us understand how effective our content is, what interests our customers and to improve how our website works. This information is used for statistical purposes only and is not used to personally identify any user.

Third parties include search engines, providers of measurement and analytics services, social media networks, and advertising companies. Third parties use cookies in the process of delivering content, including ads relevant to your interests, to measure the effectiveness of their ads, and to perform services. How to control cookies You can control and/or delete cookies as you wish â for details, see aboutcookies.org. You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer and you can set most browsers to prevent them from being placed. (1) To process and deliver your order including: recording your order details; keeping you informed about the order status; process payments and refunds, collect money owed to us; (2) To protect our customers, boohoo group companies and website from fraud and theft, which involves automated decision making to assist such fraud prevention and detection (1) To manage our relationship with you, including: providing you with any information, products and services that you request from us(or that has been requested on your behalf through our "refer a friend" function);  (2) notifying you about changes to our services, terms and conditions or privacy notice; asking you to leave a review or take a survey. To enable you to take part in a competition, event, survey, or receive a reward for shopping with us. To administer, protect and improve our business and our website/app, including: troubleshooting, data analysis, testing, system maintenance, support, data analysis, reporting and hosting of data; setting default options for you, such as language and currency. To deliver relevant website content, online advertisements and information for you; and measure the effectiveness of the advertising provided. To use data analytics to: improve our website, products, services, marketing, customer relationships and experiences; and for market research, statistical and survey purposes. To recommend products, services discounts and offers that may be of interest to you, including to send you such information by email, post or SMS. See further details in the section ‘Marketing preferences, adverts and cookies' To inform or remind you by email of any task carried out via our website which remains uncompleted, such as incomplete orders or abandoned baskets. To protect our customers, boohoo group companies and website from fraud and theft To process and deliver your e-gift card orders including taking payment and communicating with you and/or the nominated recipient if delivered to another person. We will only use your personal data for the purposes for which we collected it, unless we reasonably consider that we need to use it for another reason and that reason is compatible with the original purpose. If we wish to use your personal data for an unrelated purpose, we will notify you and we will explain the legal basis which allows us to do so. We may process personal data without your consent, in compliance with the above rules, where this is required or permitted by law. If you have any questions about how PLT use any of your personal data, please contact our Data Protection Officer at DPO@prettylittlething.com. You have several rights under the data privacy legislation. This includes, under certain circumstances, the right to:   Brief details of each of these rights are set out below. If you wish to exercise any of these rights, please email us at DPO@prettylittlething.com.. Request access to your personal data You have the right to obtain a copy of the personal data we hold about you and certain information relating to our processing of your personal data. Request correction of your personal data You are entitled to have your personal data corrected if it is inaccurate or incomplete. You can update your personal data at any time by logging into your account and updating your details directly, or by emailing us at DPO@prettylittlething.com. Request erasure of your personal data  This enables you to request that PLT delete your personal data, where there is no good reason for us continuing to process it. Note, however, that we may not always be able to comply with your request of erasure for specific legal reasons which will be notified to you, if applicable, at the time of your request. Request restriction of processing of your personal data You have a right to ask PLT to suspend the processing of your personal data in certain scenarios, for example if you want us to establish the accuracy of the data, or you have objected to our use of your data but we need to verify whether we have overriding legitimate grounds to use it. Where processing is restricted, we are allowed to retain sufficient information about you to ensure that the restriction is respected in future. Request the transfer of your personal data You have the right to obtain a digital copy of your personal data or request the transfer of your personal data to another company. Please note though that this right only applies to automated data which you initially provided consent for us to use or where we used the data to perform a contract with you. Object to processing of your personal data You have the right to object to the processing of your personal data where we believe we have a legitimate interest in processing it (as explained above). You also have the right to object to our processing of your personal data for direct marketing purposes. In some cases, we may demonstrate that we have compelling legitimate grounds to process your data which override your rights and freedoms. Request human intervention for automated decision making and profiling You have the right to request human intervention where we are carrying out automated decision making when processing your personal data. This form of processing is permitted where it is necessary as part of our contract with you, providing that appropriate safeguards are in place or your explicit consent has been obtained. We will try to respond to all legitimate requests within one month. Occasionally, it may take us longer than a month if your request is particularly complex or you have made a number of requests. In this case, we will notify you and keep you updated. We may need to request specific information from you to help us confirm your identity and ensure your right to exercise any of the above rights. This is a security measure to ensure that personal data is not disclosed to any person who has no right to receive it. Right to lodge a complaint If you have any concerns or complaints regarding the way in which we process your data, please email us directly at DPO@prettylittlething.com. You also have the right to make a complaint to the ICO (the data protection regulator in the UK) or (if you are located in the European Union) any other competent supervisory authority in your country of residence (a list of supervisory authorities can be found here: https://edpb.europa.eu/about-edpb/about-edpb/members_en). We would, however, appreciate the chance to deal with your concerns before you approach the ICO or any other supervisory authority, so please do contact us in the first instance. Your data and countries outside of Europe The personal data we collect from you may be transferred to, and stored at, destinations outside the European Economic Area ("EEA") using legally-provided mechanisms to lawfully transfer data across borders. It may also be processed by staff operating outside the EEA who work for us or for one of our suppliers. Such staff may be engaged in, among other things, the fulfilment of your order, the processing of your payment details and the provision of support services. We will take all steps necessary to ensure that your data is treated securely and in accordance with this privacy notice.
              Whenever we transfer personal data outside the EEA, we will ensure a similar degree of protection is afforded to it by ensuring appropriate safeguards, as required by law, are in place. This may include using specific contractual clauses approved by the European Commission which give personal data the same protection as it has in Europe. More information about these is available at http://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/TXT/?uri=CELEX:32010D0087
              Please contact us if you want further information on the countries to which we may transfer personal data and the specific mechanism used by us when transferring your personal data outside the EEA.  We will keep your personal data for no longer than is necessary for the purpose(s) it was provided for and to meet our legal obligations. Further details of the periods for which we retain data are available on request. From time to time we may change this GDPR Addendum. If there are any significant changes we will post updates on our website, applications or let you know by email. We welcome feedback and are happy to answer any questions you may have about your data. Please send any questions, comments or requests for more information to our nominated representative and Data Protection Officer, who can be contacted at DPO@prettylittlething.com.. The CPRA provides California residents with specific rights regarding their Personal Information. This section describes your CPRA rights and explains how to exercise those rights.               In response to a Right to Know or Data Portability Consumer Request, we will provide you with all relevant information we have collected or maintained about you on or after January 1, 2022, unless an exception applies. For Data Portability Consumer Request, we will select a format to provide your Personal Information that is readily useable and should allow you to transmit the information from one entity to another entity without hindrance, such as CSV file(s) and/or PDF file(s).
              We do not charge a fee to process or respond to your Consumer Request unless it is excessive, repetitive, or manifestly unfounded. If we determine that your Consumer Request warrants a fee, we will tell you why we made that decision and provide you with a cost estimate before completing your request.
               As described above, our use of cookies is considered a “sale” under the CPRA. We do not otherwise sell your Personal Information for monetary consideration.
